name: Finnish PHR's capability statement for acceptance testing R4
description: The capability statement for Kanta PHR service client software acceptance testing environment

security.description: The usage of OAuth 2.0 with Finnish PHR can be found at kanta.fi

interaction.documentation: Conditional create allows only the use of identifier as condition

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: Logical id of this artifact

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Time period the plan covers

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Who care plan is for

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Status of the plan

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Return careplans with this external identifier

interaction.documentation: Conditional create allows only the use of identifier as condition
Only the source of the resource or Omakanta can delete resources

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: Logical id of this artifact

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period. AND operator is supported.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient that the observation is about, mandatory search parameter

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: The code of the observation type. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code]. OR operator is supported. If searching with multiple codes and code.system isn't given, default codesystem http://loinc.org will be used.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: The unique id for a particular observation. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code].

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: The classification of the type of observation. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code].

searchParam.name: _total
searchParam.documentation: Total count of resources

interaction.documentation: Conditional create allows only the use of identifier as condition

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: Logical id of this artifact

interaction.documentation: Conditional create allows only the use of identifier as condition
Only the source of the resource or Omakanta can delete resources
Implemented per the specification (or Insert other doco here)

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: Logical id of this artifact

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed

searchParam.name: effective-time
searchParam.documentation: Date administration happened (or did not happen)

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The identity of a patient to list administrations for, mandatory search parameter

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Return administrations with this external identifier. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code].

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Return administrations of this medication code. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code]. OR operator is supported. If searching with multiple codes and code.system isn't given, default codesystem http://phr.kanta.fi/CodeSystem/fiphr-cs-insulincode will be used.

searchParam.name: _total
searchParam.documentation: Total count of resources

interaction.documentation: Conditional create allow only identifier parameter

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: Logical id of this artifact

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: A code that corresponds to the questionnaire or one of its groups. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code].

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: An identifier for the questionnaire. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code].

searchParam.name: url
searchParam.documentation: The logical URL for the questionnaire

searchParam.name: _total
searchParam.documentation: Total count of resources

searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed

searchParam.name: questionnaire
searchParam.documentation: The questionnaire the answers are provided for

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient that is the subject of the questionnaire, mandatory search parameter

searchParam.name: authored
searchParam.documentation: When the questionnaire was authored

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: The unique identifier for the questionnaire response. The following syntaxes are supported: [parameter]=[code] and [parameter]=[system]|[code].

searchParam.documentation: Total count of resources
